name: vcf_to_variants
title: Import VCF
summary: Converts .vcf file to a DNAnexus table
description: Converts .vcf file to a DNAnexus table for subsequent processing and visualization in the DNAnexus platform

inputSpec.name: reference
inputSpec.label: Reference Genome
inputSpec.help: The reference genome to call variants against

inputSpec.name: output name
inputSpec.label: Output Name
inputSpec.help: The name of the generated variants object

inputSpec.name: compress_reference
inputSpec.label: Compress Reference
inputSpec.help: If selected, contiguous reference calls in the genome will be condensed to one row. This often saves significant space

inputSpec.name: compress_no_call
inputSpec.label: Compress No-call
inputSpec.help: If selected, contiguous no-calls in the genome will be condensed to one row. This often saves significant space

inputSpec.name: infer_no_call
inputSpec.label: Infer No-call
inputSpec.help: If selected, regions of the genome lacking data in the VCF file will be labelled as "No-call"

inputSpec.name: file_encoding
inputSpec.label: Encoding of File
inputSpec.help: What character encoding to use when parsing the file

inputSpec.name: additional_types
inputSpec.label: Additional Types
inputSpec.help: A comma separated list of additional types to apply to the variants table. For example, adding "dbsnp" (without quotes) would give the variants table type dbsnp
